messages.subject: Unschooling math was re: Introduction and question
messages.msgSnippet: ... that are important - CAN be picked up (WILL be picked up) in a math-healthy unschooling family. Care to elaborate Pam? What do you (the mathemetician)
messages.messageBody:
>>The underlying concepts that are important - and the few math skills
that are important - CAN be picked up (WILL be picked up) in a math-healthy
unschooling family.>>

Care to elaborate Pam? What do you (the mathemetician) consider to be the
important concepts and skills? And what does a math-healthy unschooling
family do in a practical sense to support their kids understanding of the
language of numbers and patterns?

Life is good.
~Mary, who can't wait to hear Pam's "unschooling math" presentation at the
SC Conference!
